member.summary: Deconstruct the instance to three values that specifies and indicates the details of that type.
member.param: Indicates whether the type is a value type.
Indicates whether the type is a reference type.
Indicates whether the type is a nullable type.

member.name: M:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.Extensions.ITypeSymbolEx.IsNullableType(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ITypeSymbol)
member.summary:
Determine whether the current type symbol is a nullable type. The nullable types are:
Nullable value type (abbr. NVT), i.e. .
Nullable reference type (abbr. NRT).
member.remarks: This method also checks the nullable state when the type is a nullable reference type. For example, if the code is like var p = new Class();, p is always corresponds to nullable type Class?; however, because the initialization clause is a clause, so the type result will be Class instead of Class?, because current state is not .

member.name: M:Sudoku.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.Extensions.ITypeSymbolEx.GetAllMembers(Microsoft.CodeAnalysis.ITypeSymbol)

member.summary: Determine whether the specified method syntax node is an valid deconstruction method declaration of a type.
member.param: A value indicating whether the all parameters can be corresponding to the members in that type.
